channel.title: 纽约时报热门
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: Late Saturday night, Gov. Gavin Newsom of California accused Texas of insulating its abortion law from the courts, and then called on lawmakers to use a similar strategy to go after the gun industry. https://t.co/j9CFqAWY9v
The prolific writer Anne Rice has died at 80. The Gothic novelist was famous for “Interview With the Vampire,” which was made into a hit movie. https://t.co/SvqnWLnL27

A Texas law constricts teachers when it comes to race and history. Now the fierce battle over what can be taught has become something broader, an effort to curtail and even ban books, including classics of American literature. https://t.co/NVjPkGnCLc

Insufficient sleep can have widespread damaging effects on physical and mental health, including increased risk of developing heart disease, high blood pressure, stroke and Type 2 diabetes, a growing body of evidence suggests. https://t.co/TngMpvgj9w

President Biden pledged to aid the six states that were struck by tornadoes and said federal search-and-rescue teams had been deployed to the affected areas. https://t.co/J8JQ3EmSrM https://t.co/Mj7RMk6CzS

Breaking News: Over 100 are feared dead in Kentucky, and at least 6 died at an Amazon warehouse in Illinois, after tornadoes struck several states.
https://t.co/6Dm7bNFBb3

Mental health has become its own pandemic during Covid, with soaring rates of anxiety, depression and burnout. Psychologists say both resilience and the ability to grow from adversity can be cultivated. Here are four ways to get started. https://t.co/0e6BF03HkF

President Biden directed that federal resources “be surged immediately” to the areas most affected by the tornadoes that swept across five states overnight, according to a statement from the White House. https://t.co/luBCqfCA3L

Karen McDonald, who, in an unusual move, charged Ethan Crumbley’s parents with involuntary manslaughter, said doing so was gut judgment. Despite pushback from some of her staff members, McDonald said she’s not afraid to lose. https://t.co/9zJJ2t1POT https://t.co/rPlYTlxDas

President Biden on Friday said he was "deeply troubled" by Kellogg's plan to replace 1,400 employees who have been on strike since October. Biden called the move "an existential attack on the union and its members' jobs and livelihoods." https://t.co/GfFWXSNWzl

A YouTuber who investigates cold cases found the car of two Tennessee teenagers who went missing 21 years ago submerged in a river. It's at least the fourth discovery by amateur investigators in two months. https://t.co/ShvYA6ENUq

Some of the worst destruction from the Kentucky tornado was centered in Mayfield, a town of nearly 10,000 people. At least 110 people were huddled inside a candle factory in the area when a tornado ripped through. https://t.co/1VRJZXLBWw https://t.co/Mh3i3oEzZa
Search-and-rescue operations were continuing on Saturday morning after a tornado struck an Amazon warehouse in Edwardsville, Illinois, late Friday. https://t.co/4oJA1P9oGi
Breaking News: U.S. inflation hit the highest rate in a generation last month. Consumer prices rose nearly 7%, driven by supply chain woes, demand and housing costs. https://t.co/blqcPdkQIS
Breaking News: Jussie Smollett was found guilty of falsely reporting to the police that he was the victim of a racist and homophobic assault in 2019. https://t.co/ANBiAgMKWv

The 38-page PowerPoint document with extreme plans to overturn the election that Mark Meadows provided to the 1/6 committee was circulated on Capitol Hill by Phil Waldron, a retired colonel who describes his background as involving “information warfare." https://t.co/TZCA8gLixn
A former member of the Proud Boys from Texas who traveled to Portland, Oregon, to confront protesters there last year was sentenced on Friday to 10 years in prison. https://t.co/6zQLTvqtsK
Breaking News: At least 50 people were feared dead in tornadoes in Kentucky, the governor said, after a string of powerful storms tore through several states. https://t.co/HTusERmBBo
Of 43 Covid-19 Omicron variant cases reported in 22 states, so far only one patient required hospitalization, and there have been no deaths, the C.D.C. said. https://t.co/vSzOi3rmBT
A former member of the Proud Boys from Texas who traveled to Portland, Oregon, to confront protesters there last year was sentenced on Friday to 10 years in prison. https://t.co/tVleAliEOO

11.2 million oysters have been added to the Hudson River off the coast of Lower Manhattan in the past six months.
The bivalves are helping to filter the polluted water and create new habitats for other marine life. https://t.co/zYZHcKJ7je

Breaking News: The Supreme Court ruled that abortion providers could challenge a Texas law banning abortion after six weeks, but kept the law in effect for now. The decision was both a victory for and disappointment to abortion rights supporters. https://t.co/HzHUgq2FIt https://t.co/jZdKelVdXw

Masks will be required in all indoor public spaces in New York State that do not require proof of Covid vaccination for entry, Gov. Kathy Hochul announced. The new requirement, which takes effect on Monday, comes amid a spike in cases. https://t.co/B2KA74M6w5

Maria Ressa and Dmitri Muratov, the journalists awarded the 2021 Nobel Peace Prize, used their acceptance speeches to issue dire warnings about the threats to democracies and call for greater accountability for social media companies. https://t.co/3IdgVd8VIT https://t.co/1GUcKLi2ES

Only about one in 10 Americans say that receiving the Covid-19 vaccine would violate their religious beliefs, while about 60% say that too many people are using religion as an excuse to avoid vaccine mandates, a new survey found. https://t.co/AsOdWUsF8L

A YouTuber who investigates cold cases found the car of two Tennessee teenagers who went missing 21 years ago submerged in a river. It's at least the fourth discovery by amateur investigators in two months. https://t.co/A5XCWh8kqf

Michael Nesmith, the contemplative, wool-cap-wearing member of the Monkees, has died at 78. He made one of the rock era's first music videos and won the first Grammy Award for video. https://t.co/Ed2OuEMfqr https://t.co/8PssCI3xfu

Planet earth is getting its own 'black box.' It will create an archive that could be critical to piecing together the missteps, its creators say, should humanity be destroyed by climate change. https://t.co/vdHNLzj5d1
Breaking News: A British court ruled that Julian Assange can be extradited to the U.S. to face espionage charges. The WikiLeaks founder can appeal the verdict. https://t.co/cA8V8Ck9ho
"Our Santa was Black, but to young me he wasn’t Black Santa. He was simply Santa, no adjective required," writes the author Nancy Redd. https://t.co/P6T04GXzMH https://t.co/wJMVvoxxZs

A Texas judge found that the approach unconstitutionally granted standing to those who were not injured, denied due process and represented an "unlawful delegation of enforcement power to a private person." https://t.co/I8C2X403wD

Demaryius Thomas, a former star wide receiver for the Denver Broncos who played for the NFL for 10 seasons before retiring in June, died at his home in Georgia on Thursday. He was 33. https://t.co/pMKprmJPOC

Birds Aren’t Real is a parody social movement with a purpose, its creators say — and Gen Z’s attempt to fight and poke fun at misinformation. "My favorite way to describe the organization is fighting lunacy with lunacy," one organizer said. https://t.co/aHJ7d65e4g

A steel vault, known as Earth’s Black Box, will be put in a remote part of Australia. It will create an archive that could be critical to piecing together the missteps, its creators say, should humanity be destroyed by climate change. https://t.co/9K4kcISthc

Although Congress has allocated trillions of dollars to combat the pandemic, no initiatives exist specifically to help the tens of thousands of children who have lost parents or caregivers.
A bipartisan group is urging White House officials to do more. https://t.co/3zV1UBVoEh

The finding is "another wake-up call for the medical profession and public health to look more deeply into the issues of overweight and obese individuals, and the treatments and vaccines we’re giving them," said one professor of nutrition. https://t.co/iEckimA4WQ https://t.co/SNAI3S1htS
Your reading list just got a lot longer — here are the 10 Best Books of 2021, selected by editors at The New York Times Book Review. https://t.co/q64VjYqj4v https://t.co/5TlR6Yoyl9
Breaking News: An appeals court ruled that Congress may see White House records of Donald Trump’s communications and movements related to the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol. https://t.co/jsRdpxL00L
Breaking News: New York passed a bill allowing noncitizens who are legally in the country to vote in local elections, becoming the largest U.S. city to do so. https://t.co/PoDiftizHg

Prolonged grief disorder has been added to the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, as experts predict a wave of severe bereavement because of the pandemic. It affects around 7% of those in mourning, preliminary studies suggest. https://t.co/7mnEm5SQfw https://t.co/Y72Ld6FrMg

Breaking News: Starbucks workers at a store in Buffalo voted to unionize, making it the only company-owned store in the U.S. with a union. Votes at two other Buffalo-area stores will be counted later on Thursday. https://t.co/cjMYJHpuwc

Josh Duggar, a onetime star of the TLC reality show "19 Kids and Counting," was convicted on Thursday on federal charges of downloading child sexual abuse imagery. He faces a maximum penalty of 40 years in prison and $500,000 in fines. https://t.co/3Jqj2EBvXk
Breaking News: The FDA authorized Pfizer boosters for 16- and 17-year-olds, clearing the way for several million teenagers to get an additional shot. https://t.co/wDpzzHOQlN https://t.co/iiz0hZRAEb

Birds Aren’t Real is a parody social movement with a purpose, its creators say — and Gen Z’s attempt to fight and poke fun at misinformation. "My favorite way to describe the organization is fighting lunacy with lunacy," one organizer said. https://t.co/FkGjBxwwNc https://t.co/ALeuTHT2f8
Breaking News: The Metropolitan Museum of Art announced that the Sackler name would be removed from seven exhibition spaces over the family’s ties to the opioid crisis. https://t.co/NFV3dHv4kO
New Zealand plans to eventually ban all cigarette sales, gradually raising the smoking age until it covers its entire population. https://t.co/9bPGRgQqf8
Breaking News: New York’s attorney general subpoenaed Donald Trump to testify in a civil fraud inquiry into his business practices. https://t.co/WDVJ2iqhx2

"In this lesson, I’m going to face one of my most public defeats head-on by sharing with you the speech I had hoped to deliver if I had won the 2016 election," Hillary Clinton said in a MasterClass video. "I’ve never shared this with anybody." https://t.co/TfigRB6rTl

"I was seeing intimate, long-lost footage of the world’s most famous band preparing for its final performance," writes @amandahess of "The Beatles: Get Back."
"And I couldn’t stop watching Yoko Ono sitting around, doing nothing." https://t.co/vhg7YCDPVL

In Opinion
“With every shift, I see the strain people sick with Covid-19 put on my hospital,” writes Rob Davidson, an emergency physician in a rural area of West Michigan, in a guest essay. “Their choice to not get vaccinated is not personal.” https://t.co/Hcc0lBAi93
